senses.de: A group of objects or things collected together
senses.ex: She has a large collection of coins.

Tips.title: Subject Interest
Tips.description: Collection implies a curated set, often reflecting personal interest or expertise in the subject.
Tips.example: His collection of vintage postcards is impressive.

Tips.title: Value Perception
Tips.description: A collection often grows in value, whether sentimental or monetary, due to its uniqueness or rarity.
Tips.example: Her stamp collection might be worth thousands.

senses.de: The action or process of collecting something
senses.ex: The collection of funds for the charity was a huge success.

Tips.title: Active Effort
Tips.description: Emphasizes an active, ongoing process, such as gathering items or information over time.
Tips.example: The museum's ongoing collection of artifacts continues.

Tips.title: Purposeful Gathering
Tips.description: The action often has a clear aim or goal, like raising money or bringing together data.
Tips.example: The data collection will enhance our research.

senses.de: A clothing designer's set of outfits for a particular season or purpose
senses.ex: The designer will showcase his new collection at the fashion show.

Tips.title: Fashion Specific
Tips.description: Used in fashion, it refers to a specifically designed set of clothing for a particular time.
Tips.example: The fall collection features cozy knitwear.

Tips.title: Designer's Creativity
Tips.description: A collection showcases the designer's creativity and thematic focus for that season.

senses.de: The action of bringing or receiving something together in one place
senses.ex: The delivery company is responsible for the collection of parcels.

Tips.title: Delivery Context
Tips.description: In logistics, collection often means the act of picking up items from different locations.
Tips.example: Parcel collection will occur daily at 5 PM.

senses.de: A book or recording containing various texts, poems, songs, or musical pieces
senses.ex: The library has a new collection of short stories.

Tips.title: Literary Variety
Tips.description: In literature or music, collection refers to an assortment of selected works.
Tips.example: This collection of essays spans various topics.

Tips.title: Thematic Unity
Tips.description: Pieces in a collection often share a theme, style, or authorship.
Tips.example: The poetry collection explores love and loss.

Accumulate.wordDefinition:
Accumulate means to gradually gather or collect something over time, often with the intention of building up a larger quantity or value.

For example, you may accumulate wealth by saving money over many years.

Collections can be accumulated over time, but they are not necessarily the result of intentional accumulation.

Accumulate is the action of gradually gathering something over time, while collection refers to the purposeful gathering or assembly of a group of items.

Aggregate.wordDefinition:
Aggregate and collection are both words used to describe a grouping of things, but there is a subtle difference between them.

Aggregate refers to a collection of things that are brought together as a whole. These things may be similar or related in some way, but they are combined to make a new entity.

For example, in economics, the term 'aggregate demand' refers to the total amount of goods and services that consumers and businesses are willing to buy at a certain price level.

The main difference between aggregate and collection is that aggregate describes a group of things that are combined to make a new entity, while a collection describes a group of individual things that are grouped together based on some common factor or purpose.

Array.wordDefinition:
An array is a type of data structure that stores a fixed-size sequence of elements of the same type.

In other words, it's like a list of items that are all the same kind of thing. For example, an array of integers might store the numbers 1, 2, and 3.

It can refer to any type of data structure, not just arrays.

You would use an array if you need to store a fixed-size sequence of items that are all the same type. For example, if you needed to store the high scores of a video game, you might use an array of integers.

Assortment.wordDefinition:
Assortment and collection are both words that refer to a group of similar things. The difference between them is that an assortment includes items that are different from each other in size, color, or shape, while a collection includes items that are similar to each other in some way.

For example, if you go to a candy store, you might see an assortment of different types of candy, such as gummies, chocolates, and hard candies.

These types of candy are different in size, flavor, and texture, but are all considered part of the candy assortment.

Both assortment and collection can be used in many different contexts, but the main difference is that an assortment is made up of different items, while a collection is made up of similar items.

Compilation.wordDefinition:
A compilation is a collection of information or creative works, often gathered together to present a comprehensive or representative view of a particular topic or genre, such as a compilation of music hits or a compilation of scientific research papers.

Compilations are more often used in the context of creative works or data analysis, where people are seeking to present a holistic view of something, such as how music has evolved over time or what the current state of scientific knowledge is on a specific topic.

Gather.wordDefinition:
Gather refers to the act of bringing together things or people that are scattered or dispersed, often without any specific purpose.

It is generally used when referring to something that is more haphazard or spontaneous, such as gathering a group of friends for a picnic.

Collection implies intention and purpose, while gather implies spontaneity and lack of purpose.

Group.wordDefinition:
A collection refers to a group of items or objects that have been gathered or accumulated systematically, usually by an individual.

A group refers to a number of people or things that are together in one place or have a common characteristic. This can include groups of friends, animals, or plants.

Groups can be organized for various reasons, such as socializing or achieving a goal.

In summary, collections refer to a gathering of things while groups refer to a gathering of people or things with a common characteristic.

Series.wordDefinition:
A series refers to a sequence of things that are related to each other and follow each other in a particular order. For example, a series of books in a particular genre, a series of lessons in a course, or a series of movies in a franchise.

A collection is a group of similar things while a series is a sequence of related things. Collections are typically formed based on interest or preference while series are typically created for entertainment or educational purposes.

Set.wordDefinition:
A set is a collection of items that have a specific order or arrangement, and are often related to one another or form a complete group.

For example, a set of furniture, a set of tools, a set of cards.

Collection is a general term while set is more specific and ordered.

A collection can be used in everyday language while a set is more common in formal or technical language.

quotes.Text: HBOS had robbed me of my marriage, my family, my businesses, my longstanding friend and business partner, my income, my investments, my self-respect, my reputation, my privacy, my physical and mental health. It cost me my security, my image rights, my collection of classic cars - and very nearly my life.
quotes.Title: English Producer
quotes.Name: Noel Edmonds

quotes.Text: Art, like real estate, is half science, half gut. We go to a lot of art fairs. We have two full-time art experts who help me make all the decisions about how to build the corporate and personal collection and what we put in our developments. We don't let interior designers pick art for us.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jorge M. Perez

quotes.Text: My mother was a very big inspiration. She loved fashion. I loved art in school, and I was very good at drawing. I could sit at the table forever and just dream up collections and draw.
quotes.Title: Colombian Critic
quotes.Name: Nina Garcia

quotes.Text: I am proud that my collections have received such praise, and I am even more proud to share the stage with so many talented designers.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Nicole Richie

quotes.Text: I have this data bank garbage can in the back of my head that is an emotional collection of events that have occurred in my life.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Gary Sherman

quotes.Text: I have the world's largest collection of seashells. I keep it on all the beaches of the world... perhaps you've seen it.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Steven Wright

quotes.Text: My sisters and I are very hands-on with our collections. I am really passionate about kids' clothes.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Kourtney Kardashian

quotes.Text: I believe that every life is a collection of individual 'journey stories.
quotes.Title: German Businessman
quotes.Name: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

quotes.Text: Whenever I'm doing a collection, I'm inspired by the world around us.
quotes.Title: American Designer
quotes.Name: Virgil Abloh

quotes.Text: Always my collections are made of different influences.
quotes.Title: French Designer
quotes.Name: Jean Paul Gaultier
